title: Web 2.0-Based Reading, Writing, and Literacy Education Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital tool proficiency and secondary education experience
context.additional_context: A course for current secondary school teachers to acquire language teaching methods using Web 2.0 tools. Digital devices (tablets/laptops) are provided, with competency assessed through project-based evaluations for practical application

learning_goals: Learners can propose three instructional design plans for reading and writing classes using Web 2.0 tools (blogs, wikis, collaborative platforms, etc.).
Learners can develop and implement Web 2.0-based literacy education activities that promote learner engagement.
Analyze and evaluate educational strategies that reflect information utilization design and integrated design principles, and apply them to actual classroom instruction.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
